Thanks to a grant from the Michigan Space Grant Consortium, the MISTEM Network, and Wings Over the Rockies Air and Space Museum in Denver, Colorado, up to 100 students in grades 3-12 can receive a scholarship to attend virtual air and space camps scheduled in June and July. With the recent SpaceX/NASA launch, there is a huge interest in this field right now, and we hope to get even more students interested by attending virtual camps.

The attached informational flyer has all of the information and the link to the application form. Our goal is to represent as many parts of the region as we can, and also groups that are currently underrepresented in STEM fields.

Barryton Elementary
May 21, 2019 at 10:38 AM 路

In 2015, Chippewa Hills School District, was supported by the passage of a bond. In series 1 we made improvements to some of our buildings and athletic complex with such items as roofs, boilers, fields, track and security measures. We have started series 2 of that bond with additions and enhancements to Mecosta and Weidman Elementaries over this summer. Today was the start of a new Barryton Elementary which is being constructed over the next year opening in the fall of 2020.

Todays ceremony was two-fold: the event shows our gratitude and appreciation for our each of the communities as they supported our students, staffs, schools and district in passing the 2015 bond. Yet today also represents Chippewa Hills moving forward as we make changes that will benefit our students by providing them safe and quality facilities that will enhance their learning experiences.

Thank you to the Chippewa Hills family as you support our schools. Our students will take full advantage of the opportunities they have been granted. Today we break ground for the future of all Chippewa Hills Warriors.
